page.title: 19TOURIST VISITORS TO S DEVON
page.content: The tourist plays an important part in the economy of the area. In visiting the South West of England when travelling by road, the chances are that he will have travelled to the county by the M5 motorway and if continuing on to Cornwall will use the A38, or if going to Torbay or South Devon he will travel on the A380 over Telegraph Hill. There are two petrol filling stations on the main roads who in the summer months must earn the major part of their annual income from the tourist trade. These petrol stations sell items such as chocolates and sweets in order to keep car passengers happy on possibly long journeys. During the winter months these petrol stations rely on trade from people commuting to and from Exeter who choose them for convenience Tourism is mainly overnight stops.
